H0.text: Dissolved solute is the substance that a dilute solution contains in a relatively small amount.

H1.text: Density is the component that a dilute solution contains in relatively small amounts.

H2.text: Saturated fat is the relatively small amount present in a dilute solution.

H3.text: pH level is the relatively small amount that a dilute solution contains.

A4.text: When, as is often but not necessarily the case, the sum of the mole fractions of solutes is small compared with unity, the solution is called a dilute solution.
